sourcesContent:
let Projects =[
{
    title: "Garden Buddy",
    description: "GardenBuddy offers users growing information on a variety of hundreds flowers, vegetables, herbs and fruits based on your location (hardiness zone) and the best times of year to plant them. You can save your real plants to your 'Virtual Garden' with photos, plus, we'll send you water reminders so your plants are never thirsty. Happy Harvest!",
    technologies: "MongoDB, JavaScript, Express, NodeJS, ReactJS",
    image: "http://i64.tinypic.com/212cw2p.png",
    github: "https://github.com/SueJStevens/gardenbuddy"
},
{   
    title: "Kool Skool Tool",
    description: "Kool Skool Tool is an attempt to simplify school attendance taking. We wanted to create a simple way for teachers to track their students. We have logins for Admins, Teachers and Parents. Admins have to ability to send a mass alert text via Twilio to all parents in the event of a school emergency. In order to see the app, login with the test credentials: peter@koolskooltool.com and the password is six zeros numerically",
    technologies: "MySQL, Javascript, Express, Handlebars, NodeJS",
    image: "http://i65.tinypic.com/15wl2qb.png",
    github: "https://github.com/SueJStevens/KoolSkool"
},
{   
    title: "Bar Finder",
    description: "Bar Finder lets users seach for different types of bars and breweries in their area. Users can save their favorite bars and also share bars they like with the community. And for those nights you feel like staying in, you can search for drink recipies as well.",
    technologies: "Javascript, Firebase, AJAX, jQuery",
    image: "http://i68.tinypic.com/f59enm.png",
    github: "https://github.com/brysonelson/project-gpgp"
},
{   
    title: "Memory Game",
    description: "This game is a simple introduction to ReactJS without a database hooked up. Test your memory by clicking on a super hero. Each time you click, the characters are randomized. Keep clicking new characters. If you click the same character more than once you lose! You can track your score and high score up top.",
    technologies: "Javascript, ReactJS, NodeJS",
    image: "http://i67.tinypic.com/14xzerc.png",
    github: "https://github.com/brysonelson/clicky-game"
},
{    
    title: "Eat The Burger",
    description: "This is an introductory ReactJS app with a database hooked up. You can input any kind of burger that you would like to eat and it will be added to your list. You can then eat it whenever you get hungry!",
    technologies: "ReactJS, NodeJS, Heroku, Express",
    image: "http://i67.tinypic.com/jgp84l.png",
    github: "https://github.com/brysonelson/burger"
},
{    
    title: "Train Scheduler",
    description: "This train app allows users to input all their train arrival times and which destination the train is going to. They can track how many minutes are left until each train arrives next. Firebase is being used for both user login and storing the train data.",
    technologies: "Javascript, HTML, CSS, Firebase, jQuery",
    image: "http://i65.tinypic.com/1z68wec.png",
    github: "https://github.com/brysonelson/train-arrival-app"
},
{    
    title: "Trivia Game",
    description: "This is a simple trivial game making use of timers in Javascript. Test out your Harry Potter knowledge with a series of timed questions. Think you know your Potter? Test it out here!",
    technologies: "Javascript, HTML, CSS",
    image: "http://i64.tinypic.com/1zq9hmq.png",
    github: "https://github.com/brysonelson/TriviaGame"
},
{    
    title: "Use The Force, Luke",
    description: "Are you on the dark side or the light side of the force? Take your pick in this simple attack game. You get to pick your character based off their Hit Points and Attack Points. You have to defeat all your enemies before your health runs out! But be careful, each time you attack, they get a little stronger!",
    technologies: "Javascript, HTML, CSS, Firebase, jQuery",
    image: "http://i66.tinypic.com/m76ipz.png",
    github: "https://github.com/brysonelson/unit-4-game"
},
{    
    title: "Bamazon",
    description: "Bamazon is a Node CLI based app that simulates a shopping experience. Users are given a series of prompts about what they would like to purchase. At the end, they are given a total, and like of all their items that the added. All Items are stored in a SQL database.",
    technologies: "Javascript, NodeJS, MySQL",
    image: "http://i65.tinypic.com/2mq20jl.png",
    github: "https://github.com/brysonelson/bamazon"
}
]

export default Projects
